channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Chicago Mayor Brandon Johnson says the city is ready to tackle protests against the DNC
item.description: NPR's Scott Simon talks with Chicago Mayor Brandon Johnson about preparations for politics - and protests - ahead of next week's Democratic National Convention.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Scott Simon talks with Chicago Mayor Brandon Johnson about preparations for politics - and protests - ahead of next week's Democratic National Convention.
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon

item.title: Communities in Atlanta are still recovering from the storm that hit Florida's coast
item.description: Inland communities far from the Florida coast are still recovering from flooding caused by Tropical Storm Debbie.
item.content:encoded: Inland communities far from the Florida coast are still recovering from flooding caused by Tropical Storm Debbie.
item.dc:creator: Emily Jones

item.title: More than a fifth of Sudan's population has been displaced in its civil war
item.description: Sudan’s civil war grinds on, with outside actors accused of fueling the conflict. A growing focus is on the United Arab Emirates, which denies the accusation.
item.content:encoded: Sudan’s civil war grinds on, with outside actors accused of fueling the conflict. A growing focus is on the United Arab Emirates, which denies the accusation.
item.dc:creator: Emmanuel Akinwotu

item.title: Trump and Harris have the same goal for the economy, but different plans to get there
item.description: We look at economic plans put forth by both former president Donald Trump and Vice President Kamala Harris, with both saying they aim to lower prices and cut taxes.
item.content:encoded: We look at economic plans put forth by both former president Donald Trump and Vice President Kamala Harris, with both saying they aim to lower prices and cut taxes.
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon

item.title: Montana has become the new home for the ultra-rich. How will they vote?
item.description: Democrats in booming Montana are trying to capitalize on resentment over the ultra-wealthy driving up costs as they try to re-elect Jon Tester to the Senate. But the strategy could backfire.
item.content:encoded: Democrats in booming Montana are trying to capitalize on resentment over the ultra-wealthy driving up costs as they try to re-elect Jon Tester to the Senate. But the strategy could backfire.
item.dc:creator: Kirk Siegler

item.title: Opinion: Banksy's London Zoo, art's simple joy during complex times
item.description: NPR's Scott Simon details some of the new works of the street artist known as Banksy. They include mountain goats, gorillas, and other zoo animals on the streets of London.
item.content:encoded:
NPR's Scott Simon details some of the new works of the street artist known as Banksy. They include mountain goats, gorillas, and other zoo animals on the streets of London.

(Image credit: Carl Court/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon

item.title: A new round of ceasefire talks come to a close as deaths in Gaza cross 40,000
item.description: With hopeful next steps to end the Gaza war in place, it crosses a grim milestone of 40,000 Palestinian deaths. A violent attack on a West Bank town gets swiftly condemned by Israeli politicians.
item.content:encoded: With hopeful next steps to end the Gaza war in place, it crosses a grim milestone of 40,000 Palestinian deaths. A violent attack on a West Bank town gets swiftly condemned by Israeli politicians.
item.dc:creator: Hadeel Al-Shalchi

item.title: The Democratic nominees are clear. What purpose will the convention serve?
item.description: We look at what to expect from the Democratic National Convention — given that the ticket was determined two weeks prior to the event — and what the Republicans have planned as counterprogramming.
item.content:encoded: We look at what to expect from the Democratic National Convention — given that the ticket was determined two weeks prior to the event — and what the Republicans have planned as counterprogramming.
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon

item.title: DNC Committee Chair Minyon Moore on what to expect in Chicago
item.description: NPR's Scott Simon Speaks to Democratic strategist and chair of the Democratic National Convention Committee Minyon Moore, about the upcoming convention in Chicago.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Scott Simon Speaks to Democratic strategist and chair of the Democratic National Convention Committee Minyon Moore, about the upcoming convention in Chicago.
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon

item.title: How to watch sports when your team is slumping
item.description: The only thing more satisfying than a win is a comeback win. NPR culture critic — and Philadelphia Phillies fan — Linda Holmes offers advice on how to persevere through a long losing streak.
item.content:encoded:
The only thing more satisfying than a win is a comeback win. NPR culture critic — and Philadelphia Phillies fan — Linda Holmes offers advice on how to persevere through a long losing streak.

(Image credit: Mitchell Leff)
item.dc:creator: Linda Holmes
